intro: Isolepis ciliata, commonly known as the slender tussock grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features dense, grass-like foliage with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems produce small, clustered inflorescences that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Isolepis ciliata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
